definition: to get thoroughly drunk (idiom)/to get plastered
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
intoxicated

square/power or involution (math.)/upright/honest/fair and square/direction/side/party (to a contract, dispute etc)/place/method/prescription (medicine)/just when/only or just/classifier for square things/abbr. for square or cubic meter
surname Fang
surname Xiu
to rest/to stop doing sth for a period of time/to cease/(imperative) don't

sentences.english: If memories of drinks, would rather get drunk.
sentences.chinese: 回忆若能下酒，宁愿一醉方休。

sentences.english: It's the only place where a man could get slopped and not arrested.
sentences.chinese: 这是一个男人可以一醉方休而不会被捕的惟一去处。

sentences.english: I've got a bottle of whiskey here - shall we drown our sorrows?
sentences.chinese: 我这儿有瓶威士忌，咱们一醉方休借酒浇愁怎么样？

sentences.english: I feel like going out and getting loaded tonight.
sentences.chinese: 今天晚上我想出去，来个一醉方休。

sentences.english: Fred was hacked and went out to hang one on.
sentences.chinese: 弗雷德心情烦燥，于是到外面去喝了个一醉方休。

definition: to not go home until drunk (idiom)/let's make a night of it!
to drink one's fill
to drink and chat merrily (idiom)
to have a drink/small party
to have a few drinks/to drink to one's heart's content
to raise one's wine cup
a thousand cups of wine is not too much when best friends meet (idiom)/when you're with close friends, you can let your hair down
pinyin: jiu3 feng2 zhi1 ji3 qian1 bei1 shao3

definition: to drink (alcohol)
dead drunk/as drunk as a lord
wine (esp. rice wine)/liquor/spirits/alcoholic beverage/CL:杯[bei1],瓶[ping2],罐[guan4],桶[tong3],缸[gang1]
to drink a toast/Cheers! (proposing a toast)/Here's to you!/Bottoms up!/lit. dry cup
lit. sing to accompany wine (idiom); fig. life is short, make merry while you can
tipsy and merry (idiom)
to toast sb (with wine etc)/to drink a toast
to sit face-to-face and drink
dilute wine/insipid wine/I'm sorry the wine I offer you is so poor (humble)
